However, we were very disappointed by what they advertise as "breakfast". Every morning, we could pick up a bag at the reception which included some light snack. It was something you could take with you when going for a walk in Central Park but definitely not something that would fill you up in the morning. A pandemic is not an excuse for this because we stayed in a different hotel a few days before and we had a buffet breakfast there. So just add $40 per day for breakfast for two to the price of this hotel if you really want to have breakfast every morning. (Andrews Coffee Shop is great by the way.)

Another problem was that they didn't clean our room during the whole stay. This would be ok if they at least picked up the trash because it was really smelly the very last day.

Also expect no sound isolation from the corridor and no wardrobe in the room.

title: Good hotel, great people.
text:
Wingate New York is a wonderful small business hotel. Four rooms per floor, and maybe two dozen floors stacked to the sky.

Tiny but clean rooms are updated with comfy beds and resilient flooring. They do a nice job of maximizing space. Housekeeping service is every third day, so don't expect fresh sheets and towels every night. That's fine. I don't require it, and the front desk can accommodate any interim requests.

Included breakfast comes in the form of a brown bag to-go - a granola bar, fruit cup, muffin and yogurt. Don't look for a waffle iron, at least until the pandemic subsides a bit more. It was small but perfectly adequate.

Esteban at the front desk made the stay great. He was kind, helpful, and knowledgeable - the sort of hospitality professional one does not frequently encounter. Cheers to him. He's outstanding.

Side note: If you're a Wyndham diamond member looking for perks and upgrades, Wingate is not a perk-y upgrade-y sort of place. I don't know if they even have suites. Still, the location can't be beat, the price is good, and the people are great. A-plus experience. Don't hesitate to book.

title: Modern and clean BUT zero flexibility
text:
I travel a lot for business between NY/NJ and Europe. Several times a month. Been doing that for years so I've been to a LOT of hotel I'm the area.
Pros: very modern, newly renovated, clean everything, sleek & minimalist decor. Great view of the Empire State building.Very safe area close to everything touristy and business. Polite staff.
Cons: small room, no microwave (but fridge), no breakfast. They also charge 25$ for a checkout at noon (one hour later) which is completely outrageous. No other hotel does that. It's always complimentary!

My major issue is the lack of flexibility when it comes to the check-in rules. I had a prepaid reservation via Expedia but I had a last minute major issue on my business credit card caused by my previous hotel. Being overseas it was very impossible to solve the issue. They require 100 $ a night for incidentals and I was only staying one night. So I offered Selena (front desk agent) to make copies of my credit card infos and passport to let me check in. She refused and was willing to see me (also pregnant) go somewhere else despite me having a prepaid reservation.Zero willingness to work with the client and see what would benefit both of us.It had to be their rule or nothing. Never seen a hotel being that stuck and not willing to work with me despite the circumstances. Just for that I will never go back ever again. Better hotels with better customer service in NYC

title: Excelente ubicación
text: Todo perfecto y habitaciones limpias. Muy amables en la atención. Destaco  las habitaciones con vista al Empire. Internet rápido. Excelente ubicación, cerca de todo. El desayuno es un poco chico pero no está mal.

title: Excellent hotel with great staff and location
text: This is a small hotel with a great staff, room, bathroom, location.  If you are visiting the Big Apple and you have to stay in a hotel with no need to spend a lot of money on your stay, this is the place to stay in.

title: No es lo que dice en la web
text: No linpieza de cuarto y venden la habitacion con desayuno y lo que te dan es algo NO saludable (muffin chocolate,jugo de naranja, mini mini granola, cocktail de frutas que es hiper dulce , ahh incluyen en bolsa (tenedor cuchillo sal pimienta🤷) y NO creo que el recepcionista tenga el permiso que exige sanidad para embolsar esos alimentos.  Deben advertir que es el desayuno para uno prepararse y es mas NO cobrar desayuno.

title: New, clean, great location
text: My room, with one bed, was very small, but laid out efficiently and fine for someone visiting mid-town.  The hotel is new, very clean, and the staff was exceptional.  You will not beat the price for this general area.  There was a bag continental breakfast, more than adequate.  Highly recommended.

title: Great Place at a Budget
text: My stay here was great. Very good pricing for a few nights of stay. Place looked modern and was mostly clean. All of the concierges were amazing, especially Esteban. They always answered our questions, accommodated us in many ways as well. We are thankful that we picked this place.

title: Buena opción para parar en pleno Midtown
text:
Es un hotel chiquito, con ubicación excelente. En pleno Midtown. 
Las habitaciones son para dos personas, pequeñas pero bien aprovechadas. Camas muy cómodas. El hotel es súper pulcro, siempre perfumado.  
Recomiendo las habitaciones que dan al frente. Desde el piso 5 hacia arriba se ve parte del Empire State. 
Las del contra frente, sobre todo los pisos bajos, son muy oscuras.

title: Eccellente hotel per visitare new york
text: Ottima struttura, recentemente rinnovata e molto comoda per raggiungere il centro città a piedi, personale gentile e disponibile che ci ha addirittura permesso di fare il check-in e entrare in camera alle 12:30, all'interno delle camere pulizia perfetta, amenities come sapone e shampoo di ottima qualità e addirittura prodotti come crema corpo e balsamo a disposizione. letto comodissimo e vista ottima

title: Great view of the Empire state Building
text: The best experience was the professionalism of the front desk. Thank you to Esteban and Wilfredo for welcoming me and my family. The hotel is modern and very clean. The hotel is also in a great location for shopping, Broadway plays and Time Square.

title: Great Relaxing Stay
text: Checked in Early with an Extra fee,Staff was Absolutely Wonderful Very Respectful and Helpful,Asked for a Room on the Upper Floor for some Quietness Since this was a Business/Personal Trip Was Granted,Rooms are a Nice size for Two People,The Beds are Sooo Relaxing Pillows and Mattress are Soft and Comfortable,I booked an Extra Day because I felt Relaxed ,Great Choice I will be back soon

title: Times Square
text: Location is good, Not a good family size room when you have children 12 and 16. Plenty to see and do in the Garment District with sights and nostalgia within minutes walk. Customer service was very nice and helpful the room had a view of Empire State  Bldg, just smaller room than expected but it's in the heart of city so it makes sense

title: Frozen hotel and no client service to help
text: There was snow outside and the room, with windows at ground level was frozen. There was only an air heater that was off until we arrived. We had to sleep with our coats. The bathroom had no heating installation at all. Really a nightmare. There was a guy at the reception completely overwhelmed with the situation and more people was complaining about for different reasons

title: Great Location with comfortable stay
text: Close to city attractions particularly Times Square, rooms although small but comfortable, clean bathroom with good utilities, breakfast needs to be looked into, hotel great for those who have not come with their car as it is close to convenient transportation.

title: Unfriendly Staff
text: Unfriendly rude staff. Regret for booking for a week. Great location and clean room but bad service.  Not a pleasant welcoming hotel.  Not worth for the money.  Room service every fourth night. Cheap grab and go breakfast. Most of the information online does not match. I regret my decision.

title: Très bon hôtel,très bien situé pour se balader dans New York,personnel accueillant et très agréable
text: Pratique car proche d’une ligne qui dessert tout le centre,propre et bien tenu,un bon rapport qualité -prix,Je remercie tout particulièrement José pour son accueil,notre séjour a été grandement facilité par sa gentillesse et sa disponibilité

title: Great location
text: I was very impressed by the condition of the hotel and the location.  Very pleasant surprise for the price and availability. Staff was very friendly and the hotel was perfect for a night in the city. I would definitely recommend to others.

title: Do not stay here
text: Rooms the size of Harry Potter’s closet under the stairs, No amenities including exercise venues, No real breakfast.  Extra charges for anything/everything.  Unhelpful & grouchy staff.  I do not recommend this hotel

title: Location and value
text: Booked the Wingate by Wyndham using miles and money. The location was perfect for seeing all the Midtown Christmas sites. None of the "must see/do" activities were more than a 15 minute walk. Front staff was very friendly. The building was very secure and we felt safe at all times.

title: Best choice for business on a budget near Times Square
text: Small hotel with small rooms but all renovated and modern rooms.  The hotel staff very friendly and responsive. In the grand scheme of hotels, I’m giving a 5 because it was clean, modern, had a decent sized bathroom with nice shower and great water pressure. Also a convenient short walk to Times Square. And when I think about the other hotels in and around Times Square, some of which I haven’t heard of, and some disgusting and old, this one wins by a long shot. Also the price a much better too. I’ll be back.

title: Terrible Customer Service - forced to pay even though cancelled
text: The hotel blatantly refused to acknowledge expedia's 24 hour cancellation window. They also refused to acknowledge the trip insurance purchased through Expedia. They went ahead with a full night charge that I had to contest with the bank despite a cancellation over a day and a half in advance. There is such an abundance of quality hotels in Manhattan that honor same-week changes during these unprecedented times. Do not waste your time on this one.

title: Great Stay!
text:
Just had a two night stay but will definitely search for availability here on return trips.  Loved the small hotel concept with just four rooms to each floor of an 18 floor building.  They maximize the space and have updated it to be modern and chic.  I appreciated even the luxury vinyl flooring that will prove durable and more sanitary over time than carpet.  Loved touches like the abundant lighting and bonus was ample window with great sunlight and a view of the Empire State Building which was lit up to celebrate the reopening of international travel with colors of UK flag.  This brings up how centrally it is located in midtown with ability to walk down to Herald Square, the Empire State Building(checked out their new higher 100 something lookout) and  Koreatown where I had great Korean bbq outdoor complete with DJ!; then 
up to Bryant Square and over to Times Square and Broadway facilitating my seeing the fantastic Tina! The Tina Turner musical.  Finally and should have started her, the staff was wonderful, friendly and informative whether helping me to understand and navigate the city’s COVID protocols, printing out directions or just offering a friendly smile or even gentle reminder to wear my face mask when I neglected to from coming off the street.

Overall a fantastic stay.  One con that seem to find at all hotels is the thin walls, doors or I think it might be ducting connecting the rooms because I hear the other people across the hall so much that thought they were in front of my door.  But it was generally quiet and I was so exhausted from all day excursions I slept like a baby on the very comfortable bed.

title: Tiny rooms great location
text:
The hotel’s location is so great and the price we got was pretty good relative to other hotels nearby.

The room was tiny, so much so that when we bought an extra suitcase we had to store it in the bathroom.

The bed was comfy and the hotel was clean. There were only 4 rooms per floor so it was never a long wait for the elevators.

There is no full length mirror in the room and absolutely no space around the bathroom sink to put things down. We had to pick something out of the toilet that accidentally fell in because there is no place to put stuff.

Hot showers tend to be hit or miss depending on when you take them. Never a problem in the evening but  only lukewarm in the morning.

All of the above is minor and I probably would’ve still recommended the hotel, but we stayed  4 nights and never had maid service. We ran out of toilet paper, clean towels and constantly had to carry our garbage downstairs. They told us if we wanted a late checkout it would cost us $50 and they refused to hold our luggage because of covid.  Wyndham, you can do better than that.

title: Hands down the best hotel
text: Everything was super clean. Very modern decor. Excellent customer service. Lovely staff. Definitely recommend. Easy access to all the tourist areas in midtown. Safety measures taken by the hotel is also a plus. Made me feel safe at all times

title: Comfort and Convenience
text: This is an excellent location to stay. The hotel is clean and recently remodeled. Rooms are small but this NYC.  The mattress is very comfortable and the room is easy to  organize for sight seeing and sleeping. Close to the theaters and Bryant Park and it has a view of the Empire State Building out the front door. Selena is the manager and is very helpful and competent. Great service!

title: Buena locación
text:
El hotel está bien ubicado. Las habitaciones son pequeñas y están nuevas, la cama no es sommier pero aun así, muy cómoda. El desayuno, no es desayuno… meten un par de cosas en una bolsa y arréglate. ¿Sos vegano? sorry. ¿Sos celiaco? sorry ¿Alérgico a la lactosa? sorry.
Tampoco tiene microondas.
Es ideal si viajas solo porque 2, se vuelve incómodo en la habitación.

title: Great value gem for those who appreciate convenience and comfort
text:
As of Sep 2021, the place is PRISTINE. Friendly and helpful staff.

The rooms are small, but well configured. MINOR glitches include a TV that was NOT a smart TV and a lackluster continental breakfast.

title: No lo recomiendo
text: El hotel tiene buena ubicación . Nada más . Pero por mismo precio o un poco más fui a hoteles mucho mejor en la misma zona . La habitación es demasiado pequeña . No tienen limpieza diaria y el día que nos tocó (una vez cada 4 días )tuvimos que ir a recordar porque no habían realizado la limpieza y cuando la hicieron, fue muy superficial. Ni sacaron la basura . También vi un bicho en la cama . El desayuno es para  llevar con la excusa del covid hoteles d la zona si lo sirven ) . El día que llegamos no nos pudieron guardar el equipaje hasta la hora del check in , primera vez que me pasa eso. Poco amable el señor que nos atendió al llegar  y los otros dos señores si fueron muy amables. En resumen, no lo recomiendo .

title: Fine stay. Wifi doesn't work.
text: Besides the wifi not working (on any of the four devices we tried) and a very weak signal for phone service since the room faced the backs of many buildings, we found the very small yet modern room 402 to be plenty for one night.  The room and all found in it appeared to be well-cleaned.  I appreciate the nice thermostat which had great A/C for a day and night of excessive humidity.  The fridge was also a plus to store water, etc.  Well-stocked with towels and nice soap/shampoo, etc.  We'll look into staying here again based on the low price, location, and clean/modern feel inside.  Check-in was allowed just after 3pm (although it says it's supposed to be 4pm).

title: Loved it!
text: The experience was great! The staff was very helpful, the room had everything you need for a nice stay in the middle of Manhattan. Loved that they had a water fountain and all the measures to avoid spreading COVID-19. If I go back and the fares are still good, I’ll probably stay at the Wingate by Windham Midtown again.

title: No Properly Working A/C!
text: I reserved a room using 60,000 of my Wyndham Rewards points to reserve a room for my daughter and her friends for her birthday from June 4, 2021 to June 6, 2021.  Upon checking in on Friday, June 4th and getting settled in their room, around 9:00 pm they called the front desk to inform them that the a/c was not working properly.  Maintenance came to the room, did a temporary fix and all was fine until the middle of the night when the a/c stopped working properly again.  The next day after being out in approximately 90 degree weather all day, they returned to their room around 8:30 pm to find the a/c not working properly again.  They again called the front desk and maintenance came and did another temporary fix.  They were told that if it did not cool off in 30 minutes to call the front desk back.  They were told by the front desk that maintenance was no longer on the property.  So apparently, there is no on-call maintenance.  They requested another room with working a/c but were told the hotel was completely booked for the night.  I also called the hotel to complain and was given the same information.  I requested a call from the manager for the next day, which I did not receive.  I called the hotel on Monday morning and spoke with Selena, the manager and told her about the issue and requested some sort of compensation for my daughter having to spend an entire weekend in a hotel room that did not have proper working a/c.  She stated she would look into the matter and call me back the next day, however I did not receive a return call.  I called again and was told she was not on the property and that I would receive a return call.   I have still not received a return call.  I had to get my daughter and her friends another room in another hotel late Saturday night so that they would not have to spend another night in a room that was over 85 degrees!  So not only am I out of 60,000 reward points, I also am out $250 for another room in another hotel. I am completely dissatisfied with the service my daughter received and I am receiving in trying to resolve this issue.  I am a Club Wyndham Access owner and I expected better service and a better quality hotel and stay.  I am not sure if the service they received was due to them being three young black women and the assumption was made that they don't deserve a certain level of care, service and dedication but I am very unhappy with the service or lack of service we are receiving.  I would appreciate it if someone contacts me concerning this issue.

title: Great Hotel
text: I stayed at the Wingate as a long-term guest this winter while my apartment was being renovated. I can’t say more positive things about my stay. All of the staff made me feel comfortable and safe during this stressful time. They were very professional and helpful. Temperature was taken each time I entered the premises, rooms were very clean. Housekeeping was not daily but you could request as often as needed. Beds were very comfortable and it was quiet. Slept very well. Location is very convenient to shopping and transportation. I recommend this hotel and would happily stay here again.

title: No storing luggage before/after checking out
text:
I have been coming to NY almost every other week and trying out different hotels. Every hotel let me keep my luggage there after checking out....except this hotel. Very inconvenient. 

I stayed Made hotel and AC hotel two weeks ago. I arrived early both hotel but they let me check in early for free. That was very nice of them! Well... but Wingate hotel charged me $25. I guess I can’t complaint, the receptionist was just following rules. 

The room was super small but clean.

title: Amazing Place! Highly Recommended, Great Staff and Rooms
text:
This Hotel has been amazing for me, great area, great staff, very friendly, they made me feel safe. Truly recommend you staying at Wingate, the location is awesome, the Room is modern, clean, comfy, you can definitely rest and have a comfortable stay.

I cannot stress more how much I recommend you staying at this place!!!
Amazing!

title: Good spot.
text:
Like most of the hotels in this area, it's pretty cramped. But the space is well economized, as you'll see in the pics. There's really not much to speak of for amenities but it's lockdown in NY and it's tough to come by this kinda value. Also the walls are kinda thin, which is problematic if you are staying besides a loud drunk couple with mood swings. That being said, the staff breaks their humps to keep the place clean. 

Bonus: You're right next to a German bier hall so go enjoy that while you're there.

title: Wonderful Experience Great Staff!
text: I am a Platinum Member of Wyndham Hotels and Resorts. Also, I am a returning guest at Wingate by Windham New  York Midtown. I absolutely enjoyed my stay at this property as usual. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. The property is modern and immaculate. Very conveniently located. Several restaurants and convenience stores just blocks away.  I can't say enough great things about my experience at Wingate Midtown Hotel. I am certainly looking forward to staying there again.

title: Terrible Service/ Stay
text: I Stayed at Windgate in midtown for 5 days no house keeping was available, my linen, and towels were never changed or restocked unless I called down and had to get them myself.It took 2 hours to ever get new towels, and sheets when I called for them. I got charged $54 for wiping my makeup on a towel when cleaning my makeup off in the shower. I was told I damaged the towel with makeup" even though that's what towels are for to clean your body! Very unacceptable I have never had terrible service like this. I will be contacting cooperate their isn't a policy for Wingate saying "you will be charged for towels if using them" I WOULDN'T EVER RECOMMEND STAYING HERE! ESPECIALLY WHEN HOUSE KEEPING ISN'T AVAILABLE TO KEEP UP THE ROOM. I made sure to also take pictures of everything before I left which so glad I did.

title: Cleanest hotel I’ve seen in the NYC
text: Small room but clean, and comfortable. bathroom was amazing & the view was nice. Near two hot spots 42nd Street & 34th Street. Lady at the front desk was very nice and accommodating. Would definitely recommend.

title: Hotel Excelente
text: Hotel novo, localização ótima, atendimento impecável, café da manhã muito bom, cama muito confortável, quarto com frigobar, microondas e cafeteira, poderia ter uma cadeira a mais, restaurantes para refeições rápidas e com bom preço próximo, na sexta avenida.

title: Amazing place
text: The hotel staff are very attentive, polite and helpful, they made sure my check in was successful and were willing to help when I asked for any support. They went above and beyond for me! The hotel is extra clean, smells nice, and it has complimentary breakfast.

title: cleaning just not happened
text: we stay there 10 days and there no cleaning. The breakfast is just ok, and the room is good, in general we really like the hotel but the cleaning is a such of problem for 10 days, they just make the bed, nothing more.

title: New Years in NYC
text: We booked a Empire View Deluxe King room which I highly recommend. It wasn't huge but it was enough space for two people. The room was clean and the hotel has a great location. The breakfast area is small but we just took our breakfast to our room and it was no problem. Staff is friendly and helpful. It is very quiet. We never heard anyone else in the hotel.There is a bar next door and a CVS around the corner if you need anything of convenience.

title: Wonderful location near Empire State Building.
text:
Hotel stay was quiet and the room comfortable.  Perfect lite morning breakfast and friendly staff.  Checkin and checkout were very easy and staff thoughtful  and courteous.

Could not have a better place near both Penn Station and Theatre District.

title: Great location
text: Nice hotel and very reasonably priced for the standard of property. Good range of breakfast items and cant fault anything about our stay. All the staff and management were friendly at all times and I would highly recommend this hotel

title: Hotel is poor, people are nice
text: Tiny rooms, VERY tiny breakfast hall, no lobby at all. Honestly disappointing. Breakfast is nice if you are the first sitting by one of the 5 tables: F-I-V-E. At least ppl working there are nice and with a good knowledge of the city.

title: Estadía impecable
text: Las habitaciones justas, pero el hotel es muy nuevo y esta ubicado en una zona inmejorable. El personal fue muy amable, siempre atentos al huesped. Lo unico que mejoraría es el desayuno, y el espacio ya que era pequeño.

title: New York Experience
text: Great, friendly staff. Rooms were on the small size, but very updated and clean. Staff was extremely helpful in holding our luggage until our room was ready and at checkout. Staff was very helpful in directions to various locations, subways and taxi service.

title: Nytt hotell med sentral beliggenhet, rett ved 5th Ave.  Rent og pent.
text: Beliggenheten var veldig grei og sentral - uten støy. Hotellet var nesten helt nytt og alle fasiliteter fungerte. Ikke de største rommene, men til å ligge på Manhattan, så var det helt greit. Resepsjonen var betjent hele døgnet, noe som gjorde at det var veldig trygt. God service av betjeninga. Og lukta, det var ei nydelig lukt når du kom inn i hotellet. Da vi kom ut av hotellet, kan du faktisk se øverste del av Empire State Building - som ligger 2 gater bortforbi.

title: Valuta för pengarna
text:
Vi bodde på hotellet i två nätter och var väldigt nöjda. Rummet var litet men nytt och fräscht. Utsikten var inget att hurra över inåt mot ett shakt, men det var åtminstone tyst. Sängen, lakanen var ypperliga. Duschen hade bra tryck och vattnet var mer än tillräckligt varmt. Frukosten helt ok och servicen fungerade fint, speciellt Franklin var glad och hjälpsam. Pga att hotellet var litet behövde man aldrig vänta på hissen. Till sist men inte minst; läget var perfekt!

Kommer gärna igen!

title: I highly recommend this hotel to all my friends and family.
text: Comfortable pillows and king size bed. This is a brand new hotel. Everything smells good and sparkling shiny in here! Wooden floor room - not carpeted (I actually prefer it that way). I got the regular room ($95/night) and it has a substantial size TV, microwave, fridge, coffee maker, hair dryer and garment steamer!! Free strong WiFi signal and decent breakfast. Attentive, knowledgeable & friendly staff. This was my first time staying in this hotel chain. I’m kind of a hotel snob (my husband and I are Marriott Bonvoy Lifetime Elite and Hilton Diamond Elite). I truly did not expect much because of the price but I’m completely blown away! I tried this hotel because of other good reviews. And, I must say that I will definitely be back again whenever I’m in NYC! Thank you! And good job!

title: Vacaciones Enero New York
text:
Me he alojado con mi amiga durante 9 dias, el hotel esta muy bien ubicado, buen desayuno y habitaciones nuevas y limpias.Lo mejor del Hotel es Franklin,uno de los trabajadores; nos atendio de forma extraordinaria, muy amable, servicial y gracias a el tuvimos una estancia estupenda.
Muy recomendable

title: Mini break
text: The hotel staff were very welcoming. The location was excellent. The rooms were clean and beds comfort but be aware that the rooms are very compact. No separate wardrobe only hanging space. There was no comfy chair in the room only an office chair

title: Private Sachen sind aus dem Zimmer verschwunden nachdem die Reinigungskräfte drin waren
text: Nachdem am dritten Tag die Reinigungskräfte in unserem Zimmer waren, ist meine private Decke die ich mit gebracht habe verschwunden. Und wurde nicht wieder gefunden, es wurde keine alternative angeboten.

title: Our NYC stay
text: Very unusual Hotel.  18 floors with only 4 rooms per floor.  veru clean.  Friendly staff that went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. Hotel near all of the main attractions, Tmes Square, Harolds Square(Maceys).

title: Ottimo rapporto qualità/prezzo in Nyc
text:
Posizione eccezionale in piena Midtown tra la 5a e la 6a. Broadway comodissima Metropolitana a 2 min.
La struttura è bella e pulita.
Le stanze sono piccole ma complete di tutto.
Il personale è molto cordiale e disponibile.

title: Amazing location
text:
Amazing centrally located hotel; nice staff, clean rooms and brand new facilities. 
We could easily walk everywhere and the rooms were quiet and the beds super comfortable.
We didn’t like the lack of a hall, common space where we could relax and spend some time with our friends at the end of our busy days...the rooms are too small to let people in or just relax. They could have let us use the breakfast room, but refused every time we asked. Given the lack of a hall/common lounge space they really should reconsider leaving the breakfast room open at all times, no effort at all for the hotel to allow that and the guests would highly appreciate.
The breakfast room is too small and several people are forced to take breakfast to their rooms.
They should consider giving up a floor of rooms in order to give space to a decent-sized breakfast room and a lounge area/hall

title: Wingate is a Winner
text: Our most recent trip to NYC was for the New Year's Eve celebration. We were able to book four nights at this hotel for a reasonable cost, considering the time of year. The hotel is brand new, from the bottom up, and has only been open for a few months. It was very clean and modern, and smelled wonderful! The room was small, but having stayed in other hotels in NYC, we expected this. After a long day and evening out, the amazing shower (rain shower head) and the incredibly comfortable bed was very  relaxing! The hotel does not have a restaurant or bar, but there are many within an easy walk. The hotel was conveniently located, close to metros and many of the popular stops. The staff was friendly and helpful, especially Esteban, who always seemed to be at the front desk when we returned in the evenings!

title: Very near to Times square NYC
text: Very near to Times square NYC, i like this hotel, because of the location, near to the shopping center, also near to Times square NYC, very comfort and clean. I stay at the room which has terrace in it, so i can see the view of NYC city.

title: Dec 25th
text: This hotel has moved to 37th st and has been open only 3 months. This facility is excellent, only 74  ultra modern rooms in a great location. The breakfast was above average. They have arrangements for parking  on 38th st  garage for a fee. Close to everything by walking. Definitely staying here on my next trip to NYC.

title: Holiday in NYC
text: Found this hotel online convenient location off fifth Avenue short walk to Times Square. What we were expecting was an outstanding staff, very clean and delicious morning breakfast, which is included. Yes the rooms are small but very clean. The staff is over-the-top friendly. A sidenote it is right next-door to a very nice German beer Hall good food and beer.

title: AMAZING SERVICE!
text: We stayed for a long weekend in December and this hotel exceeded our expectations. We flew in on a red eye from California they were able to allow us to leave our bags, tour the city and check in hours early. The staff was beyond helpful especially Esteban. He went above and beyond to answer all of our questions, provide us with restaurant recommendations and allowed us to check out late. The room was spotless, beds were beyond comfortable and it was very quiet. The location is ideal half a block from 5th Avenue numerous eateries within walking distance. We will absolutely stay here again. Thank you Esteban for your exceptional service!!

title: Beware
text: Due to the snow storm over the last several days we were unable to travel to airport in order to get to NY and therefore had to cancel our flight and hotel reservation. The room charge of $426.93 for one night was non refundable. I requested a refund from the hotel, due to extenuating circumstances, completely out of our control, yet they refused to issue a refund or even a credit.  This type of customer treatment unprofessional and insulting at best.

title: Best service
text:
Great location. Very clean.
The stuff were very helpful but especially Franklin did his very best to answer many questions and supported us very much.
People like him make me want to come back to this hotel!
I recommend this hotel very much.

title: NEW YORK
text: Hi everyone, my wife and I stayed at the hotel from 11/20/19 to 11/28/19 I booked a double room for 8 nights at the modest price of $ 1681.00 including breakfast, the room  it was supposed to be 28m2 and when I arrived there were two suitcases, measured the room was 10.21m2 less than half and think that I had chosen specifically for the size, sink in the room, bathroom and separate shower, air heating  not modulable little comfort dry air, non-existent common spaces only at the reception sofa for 3 people, room for small breakfast, and from 07.00 to 08.00 impossible to sit breakfast even if abundant poor.  How does a hotel not have a thermometer, a paracetamol for fever or an anti-inflammatory?  An umbrella?  Before booking, ask for the size of the room and see if you like it.  Friendly and helpful staff.  Reception boys forced to stand without a chair all night for 8 hours.  Don't be fooled by the photos.

title: My new go to in midtown Manhattan
text: I've now stayed twice at this new hotel in mid-town Manhattan.  Great location for offices and Bryant Park, reasonably priced for NYC, nice (albeit small) rooms and wonderful staff.   Only 4 rooms to a floor so elevators are quick and never crowded and the free breakfast includes real eggs. A few new hotel wrinkles to iron out like navigating the TV and turning the shower on but those are minor.  And some of the rooms have a view of the Empire State Building.

title: Fabulous
text:
Stayed at this relatively new hotel for 5 nights. Can’t praise the staff highly enough for their professionalism and friendliness. 
Bedroom was small however had everything we needed. The bed was super comfortable. The hotel and room were spotlessly clean. Would highly recommend. 
Location is excellent near all of the main sites yet on a quieter street. 
No nasty hidden charges and complimentary breakfast every morning. 
Best of luck to the staff who are doing an excellent job.

title: Family
text: Selina was incredible! The customer service was outstanding. Friendly, clean, so helpful! Amazing staff and great rooms! Wonderful breakfast. We’ll stay here again and again!! This hotel is small but it makes us fill at home as a result!!!!!!

title: Consigliato! 2 passi dal centro della Big Apple ...
text: Struttura nuova e accogliente. Le camere piccole ma complete di tutto ciò che serve per il soggiorno (oltre la macchina del caffè e il ferro da stiro) e nonostante la centralissima posizione molto silenziose. Posizione ottima vicino alla metro e alle principali attrazioni (Time Square, Empire State Building, Fifth Avenue, etc). Colazione inclusa nel prezzo essenziale ma buona e completa per iniziare la giornata. Personale gentilissimo e disponibilissimo. Consigliato soprattutto per ottimo rapporto qualità-prezzo

title: Great Location
text: Position was amazing, and hotel staff were very welcoming and friendly. Rooms were clean and I had no problems with it. Everything seemed very new. I had a late flight and hotel staff had no problems accommodating me.

title: Hotel novo
text: Este hotel não é suntuoso, mas é novo, muito bem localizado , quartos pequenos porém funcional. Cama e banho bons, box de tamanho razoável. Café da manhã de cortesia muito bom. Se você é daquelas que viaja com malas grandes , vai achar o quarto apertado . Para mim, achei perfeito.

title: good location and comfortable hotel for price
text: We arrived  before our room was not ready so went out to enjoy the city and we got back to the hotel around 8 PM.  As we checked in I confirmed that we are in our requested king deluxe but for some reason we were in queen. Fortunately I booked through the Wyndham website, showed him our reservation details and after several minutes of waiting they put us in the correct room The king deluxe was a nice size room  for NYC and well designed. Bedding and mattress are very comfortable; air conditioning was quiet (compared to other hotels). The two areas that I would not give a high grade to were the shower and the breakfast. Maybe because we were on a high floor but we had to wait and wait for hot water to come out of the shower head. In addition there are two controls that are exactly alike - one for the temperature and one for the two shower heads ,  so it took a while to figure out which one worked which and which direction to turn- just poorly designed. As for breakfast, during the week it ends at 9 AM. Why?? I don’t know but it is not worth  rushing down for. Pastries look like they were industrially made, fruit was not ripe, coffee tasted burnt. Being a former NYer I knew if I wanted to get a healthy breakfast to walk to the corner to the deli and get an egg on roll and toasted corn muffin. Best part of the hotel is the location. If you have any business in midtown or want to be near Times Square but away from the crowds this is a great location. Subway stops are close by, there is a City Bike rack on the corner (only advise to use if you are extremely confident in riding though city streets with trucks and taxis making turns and suddenly stopping).  I would recommend this hotel for the right price. When I did research  depending on the night pricing can go from $159- $469. At anything less than $325 you re getting a good deal for a NYC hotel room.

title: A Good Stay
text:
My Daughter and myself had a good time in NY staying at the hotel 
New and very efficient although the rooms are on the small side.
The Staff make a big difference to the overall experience and Special mention to Dawnovan and the breakfast lady who always serves us with a smile.
Hotel tried to meet our needs and Dawnovan Front office manger is an asset to the Hotel
Keep up the good work!

title: Great hotel
text: The staff at this hotel are amazing, kind and so accommodating.  The rooms are small but still flow.  I could see the empire state building from my room.  It is located between 5th and 6th ave and is close to the subway, food and Bryant park.  We will definitely stay here again.

title: New Favorite
text: I stayed at the Wingate by Wyndham on 37th.  This hotel is BRAND NEW!!!  The rooms are small but truly efficient for the seasoned traveler.  The rooms are played out in such a way that you can easily sleep and not bump into things at night.  And the room amenities are easily accessible; Keurig machine, safe and fridge all are new and fully functional.   The staff are amazing as well, Estabon and Selina are very welcoming and wanting to assist in any way.  I will definitely stay here again without hesitation.

title: Customer service is the worst i've ever experienced
text:
I booked last minute while waiting to board my flight at Chicago airport. Unfortunately my flight to New York was cancelled due to bad weather. I thought, Wyndham is a good brand, they will understand the unfortunate situation and provide a small concession given the circumstances.
I was dead wrong... They refused to communicate and when they finally got around to me they charged me the full $159. I only held a booking for about 2 hours before cancelling!
In addition the general manager was very rude and dismissive. I would not expect this terrible service at a 1 star hotel, and definitely not an established brand, extremely disappointed to say the least.

title: Great Hotel for Solo Traveler
text: The Wingate just opened the last week in September 2019.  As the hotel is brand new, all furnishings are immaculate.  Typical NYC hotel room (small), but thoughtfully laid out. I was in town for 4 days on business and this hotel was perfect for me.  Free wifi/high speed internet, so no issue with streaming or working on a laptop.  Excellent location close to subway stops/Times Square/Bryant park.  Staff was very attentive.  Will definitely come back!
